intro: Trichosanthes villosa subsp. mindorensis, commonly known as Mindanao trumpet vine, is a climbing vine native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers with a distinctive trumpet shape. The plant produces orange-red berries that contain seeds covered in a fleshy aril. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
